title: Lily-Rose Depp while joined by beau and co-star Timothee Chalamet at The King premiere in NYC
text:
These Hollywood darlings have been linked since September of 2018, and now they're starring in a film together.

Both Lily-Rose Depp and Timothee Chalamet made appearances at the New York City premiere for their new film The King on Tuesday night, although they did not pose for photos together.

Ahead of the premiere, the 20-year-old daughter of Johnny Depp and French singer-actress Vanessa Paradis revealed that she was 'intimidated' by the notion of working with Academy Award-nominated actor Timothee, 23.

The queen herself: Both Lily-Rose Depp and Timothee Chalamet made appearances at the New York City premiere for their new film The King, although they did not pose for photos together

Lily-Rose plays Queen Catherine in the new historical epic, which drops on Netflix and releases in select theaters later this month.

The starlet wore a sleek wrap dress for the premiere, which featured one panel of bright pink florals on a black background.

She paired the sexy low-cut gown with simple black pumps and dangly silver earrings, for a somewhat understated look.

Timothee stars as the titular character King Henry V in the new film, and presided over the evening on Tuesday in a simple black suit over a bright yellow-green turtleneck.

The king: Chalamet presided over the evening on Tuesday in a simple black suit over a bright yellow-green turtleneck

Pink on black: Lily-Rose wore a sleek wrap dress for the premiere on Tuesday

The Beautiful Boy star had his trademark long wavy brown locks whisked back and away from his face as he posed in front of the step-and-repeat, which was made from chain mail.

On the red carpet, Lily revealed that sharing the screen with the Call Me By Your Name actor in their new movie was 'nerve-wracking' because he's so talented.

She said': 'It's always exciting to work with somebody who you know has given themselves so wholeheartedly to their role and is so invested.

Couple: The two Hollywood darlings have been linked since September of 2018

Smiling auteurs: Also in attendance were the co-writers and director of the film, David Michôd (right) and Joel Edgerton

'It can be nerve-wracking to work with people whose talent you admire so much, but hopefully it can only make things better...

'It can be intimidating. But I think you can take it like that, or like, 'How lucky am I to be working with so many people who are so great at what they do, and hopefully I can learn from them.' '

Lily-Rose also admitted it was also daunting having to 'do justice' to playing a real-life person. She said: 'It was really, really incredible. I loved the research process and just delving into who Catherine is as a person.

'It can be intimidating to play a real-life person, but I think it just adds to the desire I had to do her justice and do as best a job I could.

Matchy-matchy: Edgerton was in a completely monochromatic field blue suit-and-shirt set

Relaxed: Michôd opted for a much more casual navy suit over a lighter t-shirt

'Everybody who worked on this project, whether it was in front of or behind the camera, was so impressive, and I was just so excited to be a small part of it.'

Also in attendance at the premiere were the director and co-writers of the film, David Michôd and Joel Edgerton.

The Yga Hosers star was the first person to audition for her role in 'The King' and director Michôd was instantly blown away.

He said: 'I was knocked over by just how poised and still and powerful she was. 'That is not just a testament to her talent, but also to [how] she's been around the circus for a while.'

Michôd is credited as the film's director, and also co-wrote it with Edgerton, who also enjoys an acting career in his own right.

It's Natalie Figueroa: Other stars to lend their wattage to the evening included Orange Is The New Black's Alysia Reiner, in a rose-colored crushed velvet trench coat dress

Fab in floral: Kelly Rutherford was present as well, who also mixed black and pastel florals in a tasteful gown

In the film, Joel, 45, plays Sir John Falstaff.

If that weren't enough, Joel also co-produced the film, along with David, Brad Pitt and Liz Watts, among others.

Both Joel and David arrived for the premiere in shades of blue, with Edgerton in a completely monochromatic field blue suit-and-shirt set, and Michôd in a much more casual navy suit over a lighter t-shirt.

Other stars to lend their wattage to the evening included Orange Is The New Black's Alysia Reiner, who played Warden Figueroa on that series, in a rose-colored crushed velvet trench coat dress.

Chic and sexy: British model Megan Williams attended in a scintillating black bralet under a tailored matching suit

Breezy in burgundy: American model Carol Alt was also there, in a beautiful burgundy asymmetrical flowing midi dress that was partially sheer

TV's Kelly Rutherford was present as well, who also mixed black and pastel florals in a tasteful gown with lilac and white accents.

British model Megan Williams attended in a scintillating black bralet under a tailored matching suit.

American model Carol Alt was also there, in a beautiful burgundy asymmetrical flowing midi dress that was partially sheer.
description: These Hollywood darlings have been linked since September of 2018, and now they're starring in a film together. Lily-Rose Depp and Timothee Chalamet appeared at the  premiere for The King.
